channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: National Coffee Day deals in Florida. Dunkin, 7-11, Circle K, more
item.description: Break out your travel mugs and get your route ready for tomorrow morning — we're preplanning ourcoffee order.

item.title: Top 5 concerts this week in Sarasota, Manatee counties
item.description: We say farewell toSeptemberand enter October this week, and you'll find notable shows across both months in this latest concert picks installment. We start with a contemporary Christian musician who's earned 60 Dove Awards, five Grammys and induction into the Grand Ole Opry, visiting Sarasota while on tour celebrating the recent 25th anniversary of one of his most popular albums.

item.title: SBAC launches 2025–26 with “Harmonies of Sound and Vision” exhibit
item.description: Suncoast Black Arts Collaborative is kicking off its 2025–26 season with bold color and sound. The organization’s fifth Art Innovation Zone exhibition, “Harmonies of Sound and Vision: A Celebration of the Improvisational Spirit and Classical Elegance,” opens Sept. 28 at Sarasota Orchestra’s Harmony Gallery.

item.title: Alabama answers doubters, makes big splash in latest CFP projections
item.description: We’ll remember thiswild weekendby one play above all else, and how it was a microcosm ofAlabama’s returnto the heart of the College Football Playoff race.

item.title: US loses Ryder Cup on home soil, could Tiger Woods be the next captain?
item.description: FARMINGDALE, NY — EuropeanRyder Cupcaptain Luke Donald sent the message early: We aim to write history.

item.title: Vote for Sarasota, Manatee 2025 Midseason Volleyball Player of Year
item.description: The halfway point of the Sarasota-Manatee high school volleyball season is upon us. As we head into the second half of the season, we selected Lakewood Ranch High player Ava Collins as our Midseason Player of the Year.

item.title: Daylight saving time ends soon, when we reset clocks to…
item.description: As fall rolls in, we are a little over a month away from falling back and changing our clocks to get one more hour of sleep and less daylight.

item.title: State college football wrapup. FSU, UCF both handed…
item.description: FSU is upset by Virginia in double overtime. And UCF suffers a tough loss toKansas State.

item.title: Florida outlook for Tropical Storm Imelda
item.description: Tropical Depression 9 strengthened Sunday, Sept. 28, and is nowTropical Storm Imelda. A tropical storm watch has been discontinued forFlorida's east coastasthe systemis expected to move across the central and northwestern Bahamas this afternoon and tonight and then turn east-northeastward, moving away from the southeastern U.S. by the middle part of this week.

item.title: Tuskegee Airman Goerge Hardy, 100, remembered
item.description: Lieutenant Colonel George E. Hardy, one of the last surviving members of theTuskegee Airmen, passed away on Sept. 25 in Sarasota. He was 100 years old.

item.title: Here's the 2025 team-by-team Sarasota and Manatee high…
item.description: The 2025 high school football season begins with Florida High School Athletic Association Kickoff Classics on Aug. 14. The regular season begins Aug. 21 and runs through Oct. 31 (with the exception of IMG which will play into November) with most teams playing 10 games in 11 weeks.

item.title: 'There's no place like Harvey' for Parrish ESE aide
item.description: Laron Cainhas only been at Harvey K-8 at Copperstone Elementary School since August, yet the ESE aide and paraprofessional has become a beloved member of the school family.

item.title: World War II hero, one of last Tuskegee Airmen, dies at Sarasota home
item.description: World War II hero Lt. Col. George Hardy, the youngest of the Tuskegee Airmen pilots who fought during the war and helped pave the way for the integration of the armed forces, hasdied at his Sarasota home at age 100.

item.title: Sarasota County School Board won't succeed with sneaky time change
item.description: Recently the majority of theSarasota County School Boardvoted tochange the board’s meeting timeto 10 a.m., making it difficult for students, staff and working parents to attend.

item.title: Townhome and condo prices are on the decline in Sarasota and Manatee
item.description: The Sarasota-Bradenton area's August real estate market points to a period of transition for the region, according to the most recentindustry report.
